description: a(n) = smallest number > a(n-1) that is not a sum of exactly one power of each of the numbers 1 through n.
example: a(2)=4 because 4 is the first number >2 that is not of the form 1^i+2^j; a(3)=7 because 7 is smallest number >4 not of form 1^i+2^j+3^k.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _David W. Wilson_. Two more terms from Don Reble (djr(AT)nk.ca), Oct 27 2001
